intro: Sessea crassivenosa subsp. macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered sessea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prominent, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant is native to certain regions of Africa, particularly in eastern and southern parts. It grows as an erect shrub, often with hairy stems and elliptical leaves. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
